Package com.rapidminer.belt.util

Class IntegerFormats

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rapidminer.belt.util.IntegerFormats
  • public final class IntegerFormats
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility functions for the different integer formats used by Belt. Includes support for 2, 4, 8, and 16Bit unsigned integers as well as 32Bit signed integers. The 8, 16, and 32Bit formats correspond to Java byte, short, and int primitives respectively. 2 and 4Bit integer support is implemented by packing multiple values in a single byte.
    Author:
    Michael Knopf

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  IntegerFormats.Format
      Integer formats used by Belt.
      static class  IntegerFormats.PackedIntegers
      Container for byte arrays containing packed integer values.

    • Method Detail

      • readUInt2

        public static int readUInt2​(byte[] source,
                            int i)
        Reads the ith unsigned 2Bit integer from the given byte array. The method assumes that byte values are packed starting with the least significant bits. For example, it is assumed that the 5th unsigned 2Bit integer is stored in the two least significant bits of the second value of the given array.
        Parameters:
        source - the array of 2Bit integers
        i - the index to look up
        Returns:
        the ith unsigned 2Bit integer (range [0, 3])

      • writeUInt2

        public static void writeUInt2​(byte[] target,
                              int index,
                              int value)
        Overwrites the ith unsigned 2Bit integer in the given byte array with the given value. The method assumes that byte values are packed starting with the least significant bits. For example, it is assumed that the 5th unsigned 2Bit integer is stored in the two least significant bits of the second value of the given array.
        Parameters:
        target - the array of 2Bit integers
        index - the index to write
        value - the new value in range [0, 3]

      • readUInt4

        public static int readUInt4​(byte[] source,
                            int i)
        Reads the ith unsigned 4Bit integer from the given byte array. The method assumes that byte values are filled starting with the least significant bits. For example, it is assumed that the 3th unsigned 4Bit integer is stored in the four least significant bits of the second value of the given array.
        Parameters:
        source - the array of 4Bit integers
        i - the index to look up
        Returns:
        the ith unsigned 4Bit integer (range [0, 15])

      • writeUInt4

        public static void writeUInt4​(byte[] target,
                              int index,
                              int value)
        Overwrites the ith unsigned 4Bit integer in the given byte array with the given value. The method assumes that byte values are filled starting with the least significant bits. For example, it is assumed that the 3th unsigned 4Bit integer is stored in the four least significant bits of the second value of the given array.
        Parameters:
        target - the array of 4Bit integers
        index - the index to write
        value - the new value in range [0, 15]
